title: Scary as hell.
review: Where do we go from here in the horror genre?  Psychological and emotional manipulation, that's where.  The Blair Witch Project concentrated all of it's efforts to do one thing: make the audience feel scared.  While it fits perfectly within the time line of popular media -- video: Cops, Real World, America's Scariest Home Video's -- it still exhibits the professionalism that a well thought out story does.  It is a one-up on the ultimate campfire campfire story.  Undoubtedly more frightening than The Haunting, The Blair Witch Project is a revolution in filmmaking.  It is a sign of the times. We want to be scared, Alfred Hitchcock style.
